field_edited_text.value:
The Balance Sheet





ring be completed using one of the methods proposed in this Report
(or a variation thereof) and that further study be made of the possibility
of an expressway connection designed to serve the northeast.

To carry out these recommendations the Planning Commission pro-
poses that the following specific steps be undertaken:

1. The recommendations contained in this Report are based pri-
marily upon planning considerations. While engineering feasibility
has been explored to the extent possible within our limited
resources a more exhaustive study of this aspect is needed. Such
a study will probably be required in any event by the State Roads
Commission and by the Federal Government. It is therefore pro-
posed that the City immediately employ a qualified engineering
firm to report on the engineering feasibility of the Harbor Route
and of the completion of the inner ring. Such a report should
include cost estimates and should carry preliminary design work
to the point of permitting definite taking lines to be determined
to serve as the basis of a condemnation ordinance.

2. Design work to date on the Jones Falls Expressway has indicated
the need for improved administrative machinery to secure a better
degree of coordination between the various City departments in-
volved. It is therefore recommended that a team be organized
made up of staff representatives of the Department of Public
Works, the Department of Transit and Traffic, the Department of
Planning, and perhaps the State Roads Commission. It would
be the function of this team to work closely with the engineering
firm employed to make the feasibility study mentioned above and
also to guide the work of the engineers making the final design.
While such a team cannot assume the responsibility for final
decisions which must remain with the heads of the departments

62

involved, nevertheless, experience in other cities has indicated
that it can be effective in promoting cocrdination, reducing delays
and improving the quality of the final plans.

. The availability of funds is such that large-scale work on the

East-West Expressway cannot start until the Jones Falls Express-
way is completed. Nevertheless, if the engineering feasibility
report is favorable it is strongly recommended that City Council
endorsement of the Harbor Route be sought at the earliest
possible moment. The uncertainty that has surrounded the East-
West Expressway for more than a decade has worked a hardship
on many property owners and has been harmful to the City. A
firm agreement on future expressway plans would be of great
help to the entire City.
